metdetection.joint

Class JointModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • metdetection.generic.MidiModel
      • metdetection.joint.JointModel

  • public class JointModel
extends MidiModel
    A JointModel is used to model and infer one of each type of model simultaneously as a set, one step at a time.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 8 Sept, 2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The hypothesis states at the current stage.

      • JointModel

        public JointModel(VoiceSplittingModelState voice,
          BeatTrackingModelState beat,
          MetricalModelState hierarchy)
        Create a new JointModel based on a state with the given constituent states.
        Parameters:
        voice - The voice splitting state to use.
        beat - The beat tracking state to use.
        hierarchy - The hierarchy detection state to use.

      • getHypotheses

        public java.util.TreeSet<JointModelState> getHypotheses()
        Description copied from class: MidiModel
        This method returns a TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel.
        Specified by:
        getHypotheses in class MidiModel
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel, sorted by score.

      • getVoiceHypotheses

        public java.util.List<? extends VoiceSplittingModelState> getVoiceHypotheses()
        Get an ordered List of the VoiceSplittingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model. These may not be sorted in order by their own scores, but they are given in order of the underlying JointModelState's scores.
        Returns:
        An ordered List of the VoiceSplittingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model.

      • getBeatHypotheses

        public java.util.List<? extends BeatTrackingModelState> getBeatHypotheses()
        Get an ordered List of the BeatTrackingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model. These may not be sorted in order by their own scores, but they are given in order of the underlying JointModelState's scores.
        Returns:
        An ordered List of the BeatTrackingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model.

      • getHierarchyHypotheses

        public java.util.List<? extends MetricalModelState> getHierarchyHypotheses()
        Get an ordered List of the MetricalModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model. These may not be sorted in order by their own scores, but they are given in order of the underlying JointModelState's scores.
        Returns:
        An ordered List of the MetricalModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model.
